titles: The pensive lover; or, The damosels crosses crown'd with comfort. She for a time had lost her swain, for which her heart near broke; likewise she would her self have slain, but Phaon stopt the stroke. To the tune of, Grim king of the ghosts.
publisher: Printed for J[osiah]. Blare, at the Looking-Glass on Lundon-Bridge [sic].,
notes: Date, place of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
keywords: Broadsides --  England --  London --  Early works to 1800.
